intro: Canthium zanzibaricum var. glabristylum, commonly known as the Zanzibar spurge, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are surrounded by specialized leaf-like structures called bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal regions and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
